abstracts.cdata!:
The Forestry Project for Albania had the
            following ratings: the outcome was satisfactory, the
            sustainability was likely, the institutional development
            impact was modest, and the Bank and borrower performance
            were both satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that
            bottom up approaches were more successful that top down.
            Technical assistance for institutional reform: greater
            impacts could be derived by supporting achievement of
            bench-marked targets within an agreed development program;
            where institutional capacity is weak, supervision can be
            effectively augmented through provision of a resident
            adviser; involving local governments and stakeholders in
            training and awareness programs is critical for successful
            decentralization. Communal Forestry: there is significant
            value in creating a repeatable methodology for working with
            communities; small but significant steps toward transfer of
            land ownership provided a strong incentive for local
            participation, and helped build awareness and capacity for
            land management. Protected Areas: it is important to build
            awareness of the needs and opportunities for conservation;
            operational plans, based on multi-stakeholder input, are key
            to ensure effective protected area management. Project
            Management: it is important to establish clear roles and
            responsibilities for the Project Management Unit (PMU) and
            the implementing agency; a strategy for carrying out PMU
            functions following project closure is necessary to ensure sustainability.

abstracts.cdata!:
The three principal objectives of the
            Forestry Project are to: 1) restore degraded state-owned
            forest and pasture areas and promote their sustainable use;
            2) promote conservation of natural forest ecosystems; and 3)
            take the initial steps in the transition of the
            forestry/pasture sector to a market economy, separating
            commercial from regulatory functions and establishing
            mechanisms for self-financing of the commercial activities.
            The project will support institutional and policy reforms of
            Albania's forest and pasture sector and provide
            resources for investment in the following five main
            components: 1) institutional development of the
            forest/pasture administration including related training,
            education and research and the establishment of a project
            environmental management unit; 2) improved management of
            state forests; 3) rehabilitation of forest roads; 4)
            management of communal forest and pasture areas; and 5)
            management of protected areas.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Forestry Project : environmental
            assessment report

abstracts.cdata!:
This report is an environmental
            assessment of the Forestry Project in Albania.  Its purpose
            is to improve decision making and to ensure that the project
            components are environmentally sound and sustainable.  It is
            a sector environmental assessment used for the design of
            sector investment programs.  Where possible, it also
            addresses the impacts and mitigations of specific project
            components.  It was prepared to improve the Forestry Project
            by preventing, minimizing, mitigating, or compensating for
            adverse impacts.  After a description of the Forestry
            Project, the report discusses the laws, institutions, forest
            management plans, road rehabilitation, forest thinning,
            forest harvesting, communal forest and pasture management,
            biodiversity, sustainable forestry, public participation in
            forest management, and protected area network in Albania.
            Finally, the last chapter presents the project's
            alternatives analysis.

docna.cdata!:
Albania - Forestry Project : environmental
            assessment report

display_title.display_title:
Albania - Forestry Project :
            environmental assessment report
